Why Choose Us

Expert Solutions for
South East Melbourne

Melbourne's South Eastern suburbs present unique challenges like reactive clay soil and sloping terrain. We engineer our walls to withstand these conditions permanently.

Our Guarantee

7-Year Structural Warranty

We stand by our workmanship. Every structural retaining wall builds comes with a comprehensive 7-year structural warranty for your complete peace of mind.

Fully Licensed & Insured

Don't risk it with cowboys. We are Registered Building Practitioners (DB-L) with $10m Public Liability Insurance.

Fixed Price Contracts

No hidden surprises. We provide detailed, transparent, fixed-price quotes so you know exactly what you're paying upfront.

Technical Details

Built to Last

Why our solution is the superior choice for your needs.

Engineered for Reactive Clay

Melbourne's South East is notorious for reactive clay soil. We use deeper, steel-reinforced concrete piers to prevent wall movement and cracking.

50+ Year Lifespan

Unlike timber which rots in 15-20 years, our concrete sleepers are rot-proof, termite-proof, and fire-resistant, offering a lifetime solution.

Council Compliant Drainage

Hydrostatic pressure kills walls. We install agricultural drains and free-draining crushed rock backfill to ensure full compliance with Building Code 3.11.

Common Questions

Do I need a building permit?

In most cases, yes. Any retaining wall over 1m in height, or close to a boundary/building, requires a permit. We manage the entire permit process with your local council (Monash, Casey, etc.).

Concrete vs. Timber Sleepers?

Timber is cheaper upfront but has a lifespan of 15-20 years. Concrete sleepers are structurally superior, rot-proof, and can last 50+ years, making them better value for money in the long run.

How much does a retaining wall cost?

Costs vary based on height, access, and engineering requirements. Timber walls typically start from $350/sqm, while concrete sleepers start from $450/sqm. We provide fixed-price quotes after a site inspection.

Do you fix failing walls?

Yes. We specialize in diagnosing and repairing leaning or cracked walls. Often, this involves improving drainage behind the wall or reinforcing the footings rather than a full rebuild.
